result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javon K Burton

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 16 pages) commencing 10-06-2022 by Kaitlyn Edwards.
Received and Filed: Attorney Theodore Kafkas

Defendant Javon K Burton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas in court for Javon K Burton.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 18CF151. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Piasecki. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Javon K Burton appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by video for Javon K Burton.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Javon K Burton not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense counsel did not appear or check in with the court. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status Of Counsel. Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Co-actor; Victims of the crash: J.R.C; A.T.M; T.M.G; P.K.M; C.L.P; Owner of the stolen vehicle driven by Defendant Kennedy J.K.Z.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Javon K Burton in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Javon K Burton in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Javon K Burton appeared by video means with Attorney. Due to co defendant's lower pending case, Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
